snippet: Write-downs in refining and problems in Nigeria sapped first-quarter earnings, and the firm said it was monitoring the standoff between Russia and the West.
abstract: Royal Dutch Shell reports 45 percent decline in first-quarter earnings compared with 2013, as production fell sharply and company took a large write-off in its refining business; earned $4.5 billion in first quarter, compared with $8.2 billion a year earlier.
lead_paragraph: Write-downs in refining and problems in Nigeria sapped first-quarter earnings, and the firm said it was monitoring the standoff between Russia and the West.

headline.main: Shell Profit Falls 45 Percent as Oil Production Drops
headline.print_headline: Shell’s Earnings Drop 45% as Oil Production Declines
